commit 6abf83411f4b40e103b483a9760e2011d42b7d3b
Author: hans <hans@dkmt.io>
Date:   20210727

    [cyber] fix: add "exclusive" tag to condition_notifier_test
    
    `condition_notifier_test` uses shared memory and can't run in parallel with
    other tests. This change adds an "exclusive" tag to the bazel BUILD file to
    run no other test at the same time. Please refer:
    
    https://docs.bazel.build/versions/main/test-encyclopedia.html#tag-conventions
    
    Signed-off-by: hans <hans@dkmt.io>

commit 7dea797427dd73f5476f458efe1c8f36889858c6
Author: Liu Jiaming <storypku@gmail.com>
Date:   20210720

    Bazel: unified --repository_cache for bazel sync
    
    If we specify `--repository_cache` for the `build` command rather than
    a `common` option, commands like `bazel sync` will not respect the
    settings there.
    
    Ref:
    https://docs.bazel.build/versions/main/guide.html#option-defaults

commit 56f1e14b73e000f21bce31b2c94fb9f51271d95a
Author: Liu Jiaming <storypku@gmail.com>
Date:   20210720

    Bazel: unified --repository_cache for bazel sync
    
    If we specify `--repository_cache` for the `build` command rather than
    a `common` option, commands like `bazel sync` will not respect the
    settings there.
    
    Ref:
    https://docs.bazel.build/versions/main/guide.html#option-defaults

commit 0fafa0c441f646e6fdd717426a83a2aed615f198
Author: Martin Jansa <Martin.Jansa@gmail.com>
Date:   20210309

    Docker: runtime_start.sh: allow to override user/group when running standalone image
    
    * this is useful when we want static user/group/uid/gid for all standalone images
      built by different users on different builders
    
    * copy the necessary scripts for running the runtime standalone docker image
      to standalone-scripts directory (which you can copy to a PC without apollo
      git repository checkout to run the standalone image pulled from your docker
      registry)
    
    * e.g.:
      RUNTIME_STANDALONE_USER=apollo RUNTIME_STANDALONE_GROUP=apollo RUNTIME_STANDALONE_UID=1001 RUNTIME_STANDALONE_GID=1001 docker/scripts/runtime_start.sh --standalone --local --tag your-local-standalone-image
      RUNTIME_STANDALONE_USER=apollo docker/scripts/runtime_into_standalone.sh
    
    Signed-off-by: Martin Jansa <Martin.Jansa@gmail.com>

commit b154f8b380bddbe664fb9f98725fb7f8e52fe04e
Author: Martin Jansa <Martin.Jansa@gmail.com>
Date:   20210309

    Docker: runtime_start.sh: add parameter to run standalone container
    
    * with all volumes included in the image as well as the Apollo itself
    * this image can be just fetched from your docker registry and
      executed locally
    * add LOCAL_VOLUMES_CONF which can be used to define some extra volumes
      (like maps managed outside Apollo or if you want to bind nohup.out
      to host).
    
    Signed-off-by: Martin Jansa <Martin.Jansa@gmail.com>

commit 22ab0d6712e1d2fab20d2cc52bc511e703b6fda0
Author: Martin Jansa <Martin.Jansa@gmail.com>
Date:   20210319

    Docker: docker_start_user.sh: make sure that grant_device_permissions doesn't exit with non-zero return code
    
    * when docker_start_user.sh is executed from dockerfile and
      /dev/snd doesn't exist it will fail with:
    
      + cp -rf /opt/apollo/rcfiles/user.vimrc /home/apollo/.vimrc
      + chown -R 1001:1001 /home/apollo/. /home/apollo/.. /home/apollo/.bash_aliases /home/apollo/.bash_logout /home/apollo/.bashrc /home/apollo/.config.pycodestyle /home/apollo/.lcovrc /home/apollo/.profile /home/apollo/.vimrc
      + setup_apollo_directories 1001 1001
      + local apollo_dir=/opt/apollo
      + [[ -d /opt/apollo ]]
      + grant_device_permissions apollo
      + '[' -e /dev/novatel0 ']'
      + '[' -e /dev/novatel1 ']'
      + '[' -e /dev/novatel2 ']'
      + '[' -e /dev/ttyACM0 ']'
      + '[' -e /dev/imu ']'
      + '[' -e /dev/camera/obstacle ']'
      + '[' -e /dev/camera/trafficlights ']'
      + '[' -e /dev/snd ']'
      The command '/bin/sh -c bash -x /opt/apollo/scripts/docker_start_user.sh' returned a non-zero code: 1

commit 0f2e65b0abd0d7cb241629fbe75e691a9698bab4
Author: Martin Jansa <Martin.Jansa@gmail.com>
Date:   20210329

    bootstrap*.sh: support starting and stopping additional modules specified in APOLLO_BOOTSTRAP_EXTRA_MODULES
    
    * the only important difference between bootstrap.sh and bootstrap_lgsvl.sh is that
      the later starts and stops modules/drivers/tools/image_decompress/launch/image_decompress.launch
    * allow such extra modules to be specified in APOLLO_BOOTSTRAP_EXTRA_MODULES variable
      and change bootstrap_lgsvl.sh to just set this variable and call common bootstrap.sh
    * install bootstrap_lgsvl.sh with bazel as well
    
    Signed-off-by: Martin Jansa <Martin.Jansa@gmail.com>

commit 8744690cddcf1c74d1c088d3f5f2dd28b069f78d
Author: Martin Jansa <Martin.Jansa@gmail.com>
Date:   20210309

    Docker: create named docker volumes from images instead of unnamed volumes from --volumes-from
    
    * create a proper volume instead of creating intermediate container from image
      and then using --volumes-from
    * running dev or runtime apollo container leaves a bunch of unnamed volumes:
      $ docker volume ls
      DRIVER    VOLUME NAME
      local     5c20d4ed0f6a2dfca8cba1e182d8e74327d409be50925156e6ae35b8a803547d
      local     8a3105c9c0d613512f73c3b3fdb6117b55051f69a58b7daa05979a6587fd18ea
      local     8ce888434e441d9d68775be6bf962d6950fb4f6590aea6deb29d622b5c4f3958
      local     55c7ad8291648fd446b3cdab389361f81e214c66c5295d84a5499abed6b8fd00
      local     0715f504c2745f85a0c5b1d6cc983395da93f8fe7bca5f066f4265421656d557
      local     0757b2c39394975b5e5ecc2edc6da4c03ff2747fc15eb373dc7754d6f58dcb06
      local     0348328d88b9c15fc153045ebd291f067688f9f6fe9f2c71dfe76c9651543ee4
      local     430718d15fa688cbfd42099c7f8886e8b1246dafd11ae56a1b65a54bffe77a5f
      local     a41b4a8ba3b4eba78393224635f657f01b71d20994c5c4293262b07f1cdec8d3
      local     aa2874fe10829f7e12017616657f8eee2d916b1118eb3bb7469460e4dcb1c6c0
      local     aace6d89958015ea610445760b6d5d90b4930398eb2d58ad405aa0a580b915e1
      local     cfc3394ea18bc356e429089269c6b04df2ca800056b030195c02b3db29bafdb7
      local     e9d4100f63d28d9b519312a8b024d5102271b006278bca79b1a23d6b1a145cbd
      local     ebecb4233da0c79fb193ab244a371606fdc2922645aa117d88ecd7a2e0271087
      local     edf30ff61831825429177a12720798c394d37338e259a9f46eb5583de6531daf
      local     f2ad70033de87dd370291000258ad4108e582142250406157458f1ccc5115fa2
      ...
      which even docker inspect doesn't really help to identify what they are and
      what container is using these
    
      possibly the easies way to find out what is using them is to try to remove
      them which shows an error listing the containers which use them:
      $ docker volume rm f2ad70033de87dd370291000258ad4108e582142250406157458f1ccc5115fa2
      Error response from daemon: remove f2ad70033de87dd370291000258ad4108e582142250406157458f1ccc5115fa2: volume is in use - [f376385ab7155ba5ccc389a4289e6c56ebda317ecaf3bf4bd0894e1b9129ab52, 3d33606654fc2046582a925688da206a75fd45fca76529988f38cec8396b0900]
    
      $ docker inspect f376385ab7155ba5ccc389a4289e6c56ebda317ecaf3bf4bd0894e1b9129ab52 |grep Image.*apollo
        "Image": "apolloauto/apollo:map_volume-sunnyvale_big_loop-latest",
      $ docker inspect 3d33606654fc2046582a925688da206a75fd45fca76529988f38cec8396b0900 |grep Image.*apollo
        "Image": "apolloauto/apollo:runtime-x86_64-18.04-20210202_1232",
    
      create a volumes as described in:
      https://stackoverflow.com/questions/38700606/how-to-create-data-volume-from-image-for-use-in-nginx-container
      the only disadvantage is that now the script needs to know the mount path
      for these volumes, but for maps it's easy and for other volumes it doesn't seem to change
    
    * after this change the volumes have names:
      $ docker volume ls
      DRIVER    VOLUME NAME
      local     apollo_audio_volume_martin
      local     apollo_faster_rcnn_volume_martin
      local     apollo_map_volume-san_mateo_martin
      local     apollo_map_volume-sunnyvale_big_loop_martin
      local     apollo_map_volume-sunnyvale_loop_martin
      local     apollo_map_volume-sunnyvale_with_two_offices_martin
      local     apollo_smoke_volume_martin
      local     apollo_yolov4_volume_martin
    
      and there is only one container running:
      $ docker container ls
      CONTAINER ID   IMAGE                                              COMMAND       CREATED          STATUS          PORTS     NAMES
      d3b24c9e99ab   apolloauto/apollo:dev-x86_64-18.04-20210204_2153   "/bin/bash"   44 seconds ago   Up 43 seconds             apollo_dev_martin
    
    Signed-off-by: Martin Jansa <Martin.Jansa@gmail.com>

    [INFO]      -l, --list         Print the list of installed files; don't install anything
    [INFO]      -c, --clean        Ensure clean install by removing prefix dir if exist before installing
    [INFO]      -r, --resolve      Also resolve APT packages on which this release build depends


commit 1c60ca6058fc6c2c8df52d9c220a2cbe9beb80bc
Author: Martin Jansa <martin.jansa@lge.com>
Date:   20201026

    scripts/record_bag.py: change the default stop signal from SIGTERM to SIGINT
    
    * when SIGTERM is used the last record file is incomplete and error is shown
      when trying to play or show info on it:
      E1026 16:23:16.325891 40186 record_file_reader.cc:88] [cyber_recorder] Record file is not complete.
    
    * instead of changing every record_bag.py --stop call:
      docs/howto/how_to_run_MSF_localization_module_on_your_local_computer.md:python /apollo/scripts/record_bag.py --stop
      docs/howto/how_to_run_MSF_localization_module_on_your_local_computer_cn.md:python /apollo/scripts/record_bag.py --stop
      docs/howto/how_to_run_NDT_localization_module_on_your_local_computer_cn.md:python ./scripts/record_bag.py --stop
      modules/dreamview/conf/hmi_modes/ipc1_mkz_close_loop.pb.txt:    stop_command: "/apollo/scripts/record_bag.py --stop"
      modules/dreamview/conf/hmi_modes/ipc1_mkz_standard_debug.pb.txt:    stop_command: "/apollo/scripts/record_bag.py --stop"
      modules/dreamview/conf/hmi_modes/mkz_close_loop.pb.txt:    stop_command: "/apollo/scripts/record_bag.py --stop"
      modules/dreamview/conf/hmi_modes/mkz_standard_debug.pb.txt:    stop_command: "/apollo/scripts/record_bag.py --stop"
      modules/dreamview/conf/hmi_modes/navigation.pb.txt:    stop_command: "/apollo/scripts/record_bag.py --stop"
      modules/dreamview/conf/hmi_modes/rtk.pb.txt:    stop_command: "/apollo/scripts/record_bag.py --stop"
      modules/dreamview/conf/hmi_modes/vehicle_calibration.pb.txt:    stop_command: "/apollo/scripts/record_bag.py --stop --stop_signal SIGINT"
    
      like upstream did for some of them in:
    
      commit 4d428a30df56f0941f3736c937deb7e33991ffbd
      Author: SeasoulChris <274224843@qq.com>
      Date:   Wed Jul 15 20:43:49 2020 +0800
    
        change recorder stop_signal to SIGINT
    
      lets change the default value, as it's not clear why SIGTERM was used
      in first place

commit 5b0e296f3fa67ba5b2bd3d848409ac4dda26af3b
Author: Martin Jansa <martin.jansa@lge.com>
Date:   20201021

    record_bag.sh: remove unused list of topics
    
    * it's unused since:
      https://github.com/ApolloAuto/apollo/commit/0ad755804a9ce92f9d151293dcd482602f3c7222
    
    * since this change from "rosbag record" which reads the list of topics
      from command line to "cyber_recorder record -a" this list was ignored
      and can be just dropped

commit 384fb9f3df0bf33bef6c3ea87cca55b4aee6f936
Author: Martin Jansa <martin.jansa@lge.com>
Date:   20201021

    record_bag.py: use blacklist for large topics
    
    * instead of listing all SMALL_TOPICS in the script use combination of
      --all and newly added support for blacklisting large topics
    * this removes the need for --additional_topics and it's useful in cases
      where we don't know about all possible topics which might get enabled
      by optional features
    * also prevents recording SMALL_TOPICS and additional_topics twice into
      both bags when --all was enabled

commit 8edbac77cc969860085df93b96fe10f214333be3
Author: Martin Jansa <martin.jansa@lge.com>
Date:   20201021

    cyber_recorder: add support for black listing topic names in record like in play and split
    
    * this is useful to record all topic except explicit list of a few topic we
      really don't want to record, e.g. because the size

commit 204a7a7998180cf9814d171328732434f39509de
Author: storypku <storypku@gmail.com>
Date:   20200827

    Build: improved CPU/GPU build support
    
    1) Introduce USE_GPU_TARGET (inside docker) to determine if GPU capable
    2) Use of USE_GPU_HOST now only in cyber|dev_start.sh
    
    For build,
    
    1) Mixed used of '--config=cpu' and '--config=gpu' not allowed
    2) Make CPU build (i.e., '--config=cpu') on GPU capable machine possible
    3) Error and exit attempting to run GPU build (`--config=gpu`) on CPU-only machines
    4) Default to USE_GPU_TARGET if none of cpu|gpu build specified

commit b98fc61c88749b726453a9cca6271877fc05c7ae
Author: Jilin Zhou <jilinzhou@hotmail.com>
Date:   20200619

    [#10818] potential synchronization issue in accessing driving_mode_
    - The member variable driving_mode_ of class VehicleController is accessed
      directly in two functions. However, inside SecurityDogThreadFunc() for
      each specific vehicle controller, this member variable driving_model_
      can be changed if Emergecy() is called.
    - There is already a mutex guarded accessor driving_mode() which should be
      used instead.
    - fixes #10818

commit 770731f4eb55ae2be4709add3e46245883572537
Author: Jilin Zhou <jilinzhou@hotmail.com>
Date:   20200619

    [#10818] potential synchronization issue in accessing driving_mode_
    - The member variable driving_mode_ of class VehicleController is accessed
      directly in two functions. However, inside SecurityDogThreadFunc() for
      each specific vehicle controller, this member variable driving_model_
      can be changed if Emergecy() is called.
    - There is already a mutex guarded accessor driving_mode() which should be
      used instead.
    - fixes #10818

commit ffd8a4850b0c845d939134449701324fd46505ff
Author: Ning Qu <quning@gmail.com>
Date:   20190611

    cyber: adding arm platform support for Cyber RT (#8736)
    
    * cyber: lay the ground work of docker scripts for adding arm support
    
    add arm support for Cyber RT docker containers.
    
    Due to the problem with docker exec on Drive PX platform,
    the start and into process is a little bit different.
    Have added enough print out information from scripts to help.
    
    Here is the typical process:
    
    First time, start and getting into the container:
      ./docker/scripts/cyber_start.sh
      ./docker/scripts/cyber_into.sh
    then run:
      /apollo/scritps/docker_adduser.sh
      su nvidia
    
    After the first time, you can just use the into script to
    get into the container:
      ./docker/scripts/cyber_into.sh
    
    To exit, please use "Ctrl+P" then "Ctrl+Q". Otherwise, you
    will stop the container and have to restart as shown for
    the first time instructions.
    
    * cyber: prevent LD_PRELOAD for cyber only development
    
    Apollo add the default LD_PRELOAD for caffe and opencv which is not
    available in Cyber RT only docker environment, so to prevent excessive
    warnings, we reset the LD_PRELOAD when necessary.
    
    * cyber: modify core cyber files to make build work on arm
    
    todo: make build work on both x86 and arm
    
    * cyber: croutine support for arm
    
    * cyber: make swap build works on both x86 and arm

    * cyber: fix signed and unsigned comparison warning
    
    * drivers: make bcan works on both x86 and arm

    * add CPU version of yuv to rgb conversion
    * remove Apollo camera triggering tool dependencies

commit 6ce8b5c1c3fd54e34ca3cf0a11f2d426a37c68b5
Author: Ning Qu <quning@gmail.com>
Date:   20190516

    docker: adding more options for docker script to improve CI efficiency
    
    To improve CI efficiency, add two new options in docker script as dev_start.sh
    * -b for build only, not pulling any map information
    * -f for unit tests, pull only limited set of map information
    
    Due the growing number of maps, it's pain to pulling all the map at each CI steps.
    We have 5 steps in total in CI right now. First three steps can run well without
    any map, and the rest will need some limited map support.
    
    Total time of all steps in a CI reduces from about 2 hours to 90mins, which save
    both time and resources.
    
    Previous tested CI with -b and -f options to prove its correctness:
    
    https://travis-ci.com/ApolloAuto/apollo/builds/112120858
    
    https://travis-ci.com/ApolloAuto/apollo/builds/112129192

Author: Fla3inH0tCheet0s <46694471+Fla3inH0tCheet0s@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   20190514

    enable different clone locations
    
    ```
    git clone https://github.com/ApolloAuto/apollo.git repo1
    docker/scripts/dev_start.sh
    git clone https://github.com/ApolloAuto/apollo.git repo2
    docker/scripts/dev_start.sh
    ll / | grep apollo
    ```
    The symlink will point to repo2

    added a container installer script for the poco library: (#6772)
    
    1) the current version of the script installs from apt
    2) Ubuntu 14.04 supports Poco 1.3.x which is an old release
    3) The script has code that is commented out, which can install from source instead
    4) The install from source uses version 1.9.0 but has a variable for changing that version

commit 177f1dc9dc12b4fc8971d106c5b8491ba7511ba5
Author: Sameh Mohamed <sameh4@gmx.com>
Date:   20190205

    fixing build error for installer script install_bosfs.sh used building the dev container
    1) added 'autotools-dev' and 'automake' to 'apt-get install' to fix the missing 'aclocal' command used in 'autogen.sh' in bosfs gzip
    2) added 'uuid-dev' to 'apt-get install'. since fresh containers are missing this package, the build of bosfs fails in:
    file: ./model/bce_request.cpp:16:23: fatal error: uuid/uuid.h: no such file
    
    I created issue 6732 to track this.

    hmi: use '-p' instead of '-s' as hmi cmd options (#1789)
    
    Use '-p' instead of '-s' as hmi cmd options to be consistent with launching
    through launch file.

commit c1883d4341fd639b5f076df67996524b5619eef5
Author: Baisheng08 <43076687+Baisheng08@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   20181114

    framework: refactor sched related configuration (#1786)
    
    Currently, all sched related confs are all in one sched conf file and all in
    one sched conf section, which is not flexible and different conf maybe
    intervene each other. Now every process will have a own sched conf. And we
    also add some special fields, e.g. "affinity", for cpu pinning.

    This is patch2 for refactor of moving sched policy from procressor context to
    sched-policy scheduker. This patch moves "dipatch task, notify task remove
    task" from processor context to scheduler_policy.
    The patch1 is commit: 15195f80a39073cf32e152cbe17a27d4876e3088, which add two
    sched-policy scheduker: choreogaphy and classic sched-policy scheduler.

commit 849b738ed7133d59ce55b23121cbe68a31aea283
Author: Baisheng08 <43076687+Baisheng08@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   20181106

    framework: Put tasks w/o processor assigned into a classic pool. (#1558)
    
    For task choreography sched-policy, we want to arrange tasks as predefined
    graph, i.e. put a specifile task into a assigned processor's runqueue. But
    some decision should be made to the last. So we use several processor as a
    pool to execute those tasks as a tempory solution for development tunning.

commit 722233cc3147ad49b66c1bf53853c419c9d1f76a
Author: Xiaowei Hu <huxiaowei@baidu.com>
Date:   20180828

    Docker: Move apt-get commands to earlier and add apt-get update  (#5511)
    
    * Docker: Move apt-get commands to earlier and add apt-get update before the install.
    
    apt-get commands part is more stable than the installer part, which including build
    steps,this may could fasten the docker image build process when there are only
    installer changed.
    
    * Move out the content of installers/pre_install.sh to the Dockerfile.
    
    Merge with the apt-get install command in the dockerfile, be more
    clear at first look.
    
    * Sort the apt-get install packages list.

commit 4e6fac28974b64934895926df0f54dce5f7f34d2
Author: XinWenfei <xinwenfei.2012@gmail.com>
Date:   20180728

    Update comments
    
    According to the API of canTransform(http://docs.ros.org/jade/api/tf/html/c++/classtf_1_1Transformer.html), the "world" should be the target frame, and the child_frame is the source frame, so, the transform should be from source to target, that is child frame -> world. And at the same time, your own comment is also "transform child frame id", not transform "world frame". Do I understand it right?

commit eb7064591f1833418048514218a8667f0ec8bc25
Author: XinWenfei <xinwenfei.2012@gmail.com>
Date:   20180728

    Update comments
    
    The function canTransform is used to judge whether can carry out this transformation, this error should be "can not find transform frame". The lookupTransform is used to find the latest, valid and avaliable transformation, if it returns empty, you can output the tips that "can't find the transform". I think you can find some similar cases in ROS system.

    planning: use original ctpl

commit 894326161e0f8330225c6797784281d0c9460a86
Author: Hadi Tabatabaee <hadi.tabatabaee@lge.com>
Date:   20180731

    Perception: fixed bug in Yuyv2rgb conversion for AVX non-compliant CPUs.
    
    The function Yuyv2rgb has two definitions; one uses AVX instructions and the other does not. This commit fixes a bug in the latter function definition. The ordering of the color channels in the input image were incorrect which would result in an incorrect conversion to rgb which subsequently affects the perception results. The bug has been fixed by correcting the channel order the function expects.

commit 241637961173d36428b1228d8f07e148cdba5859
Author: Manuel Binna <manuel@binna.de>
Date:   20180731

    Fix filename for case-insensitive filesystems (#5179)
    
    On macOS, many developers use a case-insensitive filesystem. This can cause
    issues if Git has to handle a file with differently cased names like File_A and
    file_a.
    
    One possible fix is to set Git option 'core.ignoreCase = true' and move theA
    file via 'git mv File_A file_a' so that Git records the changes. This is what
    has been done to create this commit.

commit cef919817647b9973362e59e7f204e19c0dda663

commit 25416bbbe9fdb3a2faef4fbe3e8260e4359b5565
Author: Jilin Zhou <jilinzhou@hotmail.com>
Date:   20180727

    Fixes #5120 (#5145)
    
    * - issue #2702
    - static_assert failure on underlying type check of std::chrono::nanoseconds
    - The only requirement of std::chrono::nanoseconds is that it is an integral type of at least 64bits. Different implementations may have different underlying types. Therefore it is better to check whether its size is greater than or equal to sizeof(int64_t).
    
    * - issue #2702
    - static_assert failure on underlying type check of std::chrono::nanoseconds
    - The only requirement of std::chrono::nanoseconds is that it is an integral type of at least 64bits. Different implementations may have different underlying types. Therefore it is better to check whether its size is greater than or equal to sizeof(int64_t).
    
    -fix cpplint issue
    
    * Fixes: #4700
    Fix "start" timestamp update in SecurityDogThreadFunc()
    
    Current it is updated incorrectly after each iteration which causes
    misleading error msgs "Too much time consumption in LincolnController
    looping process:" gets printed out.
    
    * [Fixes #5120] missing declaration of "use_navigation_mode"
    The modules/third_party_perception/conversion.cc has references to
    FLAGS_use_navigation_mode but it is neither declared or defined in
    third_party_perception_flags.h or third_party_perception_flags.cc.
    After adding the declaration and definition, the module can be built
    successfully.

commit 91a39db0e55e92563d3179104b8240c70d57be24
Author: mfyanga <yamf1@163.com>
Date:   20180727

    NaviPlaner:fix bug speed config items in planning_config_navi.pb.txt different from navi_speed_decider_config.proto

commit ca115d0d4c639bd7e3bdabb82b4f6485399a42ec
Author: David Hopper <davidhopper@qq.com>
Date:   20180727

    RelativeMap: down sampled raw navigation path data.
    Apollo 3.0 used a new smoothing algorithm to generate the navigation path, which makes the number of points in the navigation path very large. It may cause the ROS buffer to overflow and thus result in the navigation path not being sent successfully. Using a down sampling strategy can effectively solve this problem.
    Instructions:
    1. Do not use downsampling
     bash /apollo/scripts/navigator.sh left.smoothed right.smoothed --navigator_down_sample=0
    2. Use downsampling
      bash /apollo/scripts/navigator.sh left.smoothed right.smoothed --navigator_down_sample=1
    or
      bash /apollo/scripts/navigator.sh left.smoothed right.smoothed

commit b2d7abb8c97b34c57689bf49cf9c192982ddb4a2
Author: Liangliang Zhang <zhangliangliang@baidu.com>

commit af5651083d1ddf1d160d0222ee8b0432dfcc6f3a
Author: Xingtao Zhang <xingtao.zhang@yahoo.com>
Date:   20180727

    docker: fix docker data volume leak (#5133)
    
    Manipulate map data containers after apollo_dev is removed, if not,
    the associated volume will not be automatically deleted(--rm) since
    it's still in use, and it will become in dangling state once
    apollo_dev is removed (not with -v).

    Copy bags between disks fix (#4776)
    
    * result2pb: fix the wrong number of arguments check-ups (#2945)
    
    Which would cause indexError exception in this case. Also, simply
    the file I/O via with statement.
    
    * message: fix msg_received and seq_diff check-ups.
    
    The former should be used if the objects referrred to by the
    variables are equal, the laster should be used if two variables
    point to the same object.
    
    * message: fix seq_diff according to the intention of comparision
    
    * copy_bags_between_disks.py: code consolidation [#4775]

commit 7808fd3d0f3402ff9532cfda2888bcd08fd2ee5b
Author: 贺志国 David Hopper <davidhopper@qq.com>
Date:   20180703

    Map: added a C++ version for the navigation line sender. (#4773)
    
    Usage:
    Example 1:
    ```bash
    bash scripts/navigator.sh modules/tools/navigator/path_csc_left.bag.txt.smoothed  modules/tools/navigator/path_csc_right.bag.txt.smoothed
    ```
    or
    ```bash
    cd /apollo/modules/tools/navigator/
    bash /apollo/scripts/navigator.sh path_csc_left.bag.txt.smoothed  path_csc_right.bag.txt.smoothed
    ```
    
    Example 2:
    ```bash
    bash scripts/navigator.sh data/bag/csc/path_csc_left.bag.txt.smoothed  data/bag/csc/path_csc_right.bag.txt.smoothed
    ```
    or
    ```bash
    cd /apollo/data/bag/csc
    bash /apollo/scripts/navigator.sh path_csc_left.bag.txt.smoothed  path_csc_right.bag.txt.smoothed
    ```

    - static_assert failure on underlying type check of std::chrono::nanoseconds
    - The only requirement of std::chrono::nanoseconds is that it is an integral type of at least 64bits. Different implementations may have different underlying types. Therefore it is better to check whether its size is greater than or equal to sizeof(int64_t).
    
    * - issue #2702
    - static_assert failure on underlying type check of std::chrono::nanoseconds
    - The only requirement of std::chrono::nanoseconds is that it is an integral type of at least 64bits. Different implementations may have different underlying types. Therefore it is better to check whether its size is greater than or equal to sizeof(int64_t).
    
    -fix cpplint issue
    
    * Fixes: #4700
    Fix "start" timestamp update in SecurityDogThreadFunc()
    
    Current it is updated incorrectly after each iteration which causes
    misleading error msgs "Too much time consumption in LincolnController
    looping process:" gets printed out.

commit f36c4c9df9988e8a131623b22b9fc5744b6b92a0
Author: David Hopper <davidhopper@qq.com>
Date:   20180619

    Map: modified constructors for the class "Path" in PncMap.
    In the original implementation, `explicit Path(std::vector<MapPathPoint> path_points)` always creates a temporary vector, even if you use a `std::move()` function in its constructor to move this temporary object.
    For example, in the following code:
    ```cpp
    const std::vector<MapPathPoint> points{
          MapPathPoint({0, 0}, M_PI_2, LaneWaypoint(lane_info, 0)),
          MapPathPoint({0, 1}, M_PI_2, LaneWaypoint(lane_info, 1)),
          MapPathPoint({0, 2}, M_PI_2, LaneWaypoint(lane_info, 2)),
          MapPathPoint({0, 3}, M_PI_2, LaneWaypoint(lane_info, 3))};
    const Path path(points, {}, 2.0);
    ```
    `path(points, {}, 2.0)` always generates a temporary vector for `points`.
    If you use a move constructor `explicit Path(std::vector<MapPathPoint>&& path_points)`, `path(std::move(points), {}, 2.0)` will only move the vector instead of constructing a temporary object, thus improving efficiency.
    Refer to "http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/move_constructor" for a more detailed explanation.

commit a914a3eb5db99972f48946ccaaf2a53f839eb1fb
Author: Ádám Divák <adam.divak@gmail.com>
Date:   20180611

    Fix startup script for users with multiple groups
    
    Starting the Docker container fails when the user starting the process is a
    member of multiple groups, as the space separated list of groups is passed
    unquoted to the docker command, which breaks the command. This is fixed
    by quoting the group parameter.

commit 6083501108ce67f475065e25242a72118386fd06
Author: David Hopper <davidhopper@qq.com>
Date:   20180529

    Planning: used condition_variable to update the reference line for efficiency.
    Because the task of updating the reference line conforms to the producer-consumer multithreading model, a condition_variable is used to inform the worker thread to update the reference line, thereby improving processing efficiency.

commit 434dd756df24a2e3ac1df1c851ee047d6bbd7ca2
Author: David Hopper <davidhopper@qq.com>
Date:   20180508

    Relative_map: fixed a bug in setting "last_project_index_" for a cyclic/circular navigation line.
    Because the starting point and the end point cannot be completely consistent in a cyclic/circular navigaton line. The vehicle's end point is usually beyond the starting point a little when making a cyclic/circular navigation line. Therefore, the "last_project_index_" is reset to 0 if it is greater than 95% size of the navigaton line and the vehicle's current position is near the starting point of the navigatoin line.

commit 602bf051ee8b2df1fb8ce92af75e2dbe094af768
Author: David Hopper <davidhopper@qq.com>
Date:   20180508

    Planning: replace "std::unique_ptr<T>(new T(...))" with "std::make_unique<T>(...)".
    Prefer "std::make_unique" to direct use of "new".
    Compared to direct use of new, make functions eliminate source code duplication,
    provides cleaner, concise codes, improve exception safety.
    Reference "https://herbsutter.com/gotw/_102/" for details.

    Common: borrow the "std::make_unique" definition from C++14 so that so that it can be used both for single objects and arrays of unknown bound in C++11.
    The helper function "std::make_unique()" is defined since C++14. The definition of "std::make_unique()" borrowed from C++14 is given here so that it can be used in C++11.

        Perception: major change in motion service/lane tracking. pass stress test. (#3956)

    *  Add the "apollo/dev_build.sh" and "apollo/.vscode/tasks.json" files to build the Apollo project in VSCode.
    
    * replace "dev_build.sh" with "apollo_docker.sh " and "dev_build.sh" is no longer needed.
    
    * Fix an estop bug. Because the function "Control::ProduceControlCommand()" checks the "estop" signal with the following line (Line 170 in control.cc):
    "estop_ = estop_ || trajectory_.estop().is_estop();", we should add more information to ensure the estop being triggered.

commit 81dd8cba0601414a664f9ae2078b1a623b37c4f5
Author: Jilin Zhou <jilinzhou@hotmail.com>
Date:   20180201

    issue #2702 (static_assert failure) (#2708)
    
    * - issue #2702
    - static_assert failure on underlying type check of std::chrono::nanoseconds
    - The only requirement of std::chrono::nanoseconds is that it is an integral type of at least 64bits. Different implementations may have different underlying types. Therefore it is better to check whether its size is greater than or equal to sizeof(int64_t).
    
    -fix cpplint issue

commit 423ab3261ffeefd2fe097dccb9d6e84395eb756f
Author: Zhang Liangliang <zhangliangliang@baidu.com>
Date:   20170925

    Planning: modified the reference line kernel. Different from the
    existing version, which treated reference line as a guiding line to hope
    adc travel via the line, we treat reference line as a driving force to
    make the adc to speed up. In this way, the driving force which makes the
    vehicle increase speed is seperated from other impacts, and simplified
    the way we adjust params. The adc will not increase speed infinitely
    because of the hard constraints of speed limits.

commit c917b379def5107f2e85c472d10b7dd72bce9c89
Author: Zhang Liangliang <zhangliangliang@baidu.com>
Date:   20170910

    Planning: (1) fixed smooth issue by adjusting parameters. (2) Increased planning robustness with sacrificing the initial continuity of acceleration.
    (2) comes from an intrinsic issue when we use spline curves to fit all planning results ---- NOT all cases can be fitted by spline!
    We should evaluate the necessity of using splines, especially when the
    cost is that planning might fail in some cases. In the future version, we should not focus only
    on the smoothness of the curves. Perfect smoothness can only live in an unrealistic imaginary world.
    We should also notice that the smoothness of planning results doesn't
    exactly correlate to what people feel when sitting on a car.
